4d05dc3c4352ebe7593b536f2078cfe9 (14:11): hi a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 or 2c5a41a96b0f3693ee5a14e7fbd5fd9a

2c5a41a96b0f3693ee5a14e7fbd5fd9a (14:12): I see
2c5a41a96b0f3693ee5a14e7fbd5fd9a (14:12): reads page
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:17): pretty cool
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:18): yeah
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:19): I think once people get their hands on this stuff, we are going to see all kinds of cool stuff
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:20): just hope there won't be too much pain involved for everybody in migrating to whatever the standard API ends up being
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:22): The Chrome thing looks scary-complex
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:31): someone should do an objective analysis of the level of complexity of proposals coming from each browser vendor
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:32): (I mean more generally--not just for audio)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:32): (Yes, I know you can't really objectively quantify spec proposal complexity)
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (14:34): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: count the number of external/internal section dependencies it adds
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:35): isn't http://www.w3.org/Bugs/Public/show_bug.cgi?id=10657 violating ARIA design principles?
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (14:38): Doesn't matter, it was filed by an expert
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:39): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, though so too
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:40): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, but maybe the principles have changed
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:40): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: I commented.

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:40): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, there's also this weird notion in the WAI-ARIA spec that AT may change the markup and that web authors have to ensure they check mutation events
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:40): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: I expect the principles haven't changed. But if they had, it would be a pretty bad bait and switch.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:41): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: yeah, that's truly bizarre

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:41): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, I objected to that (too late for the deadline) but maybe I should again now that there's another Last Call without someone responding to my comments
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:41): that the W3C rechartered it as a Member-only group is also truly bizarre
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:42): T.V. Raman has complained quite loudly about that
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:42): and he's in the TAG -- quite the expert
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:42): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: I hope Opera sent charter review comments requesting the group to be public
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:42): I haven't checked to be honest
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:42): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: I also hope Raman sent in charter review comments to that effect
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:43): I should really kill this "to be honest" habit, it makes no sense
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (14:43): to be honest, I disagree with you
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (14:44): To be honest, I'm not
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:44): heh

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:48): ah yeah, forgot about that
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:53): ooh
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:53): @volantis.com
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:53): I thought I recognized that
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:53): what about volantis?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:53): Dave Raggett worked for them iirc
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:54): the convert this XHTML2 markup to device-specific-markup people
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:54): I can't remember if Dave did or not, but Rhys Lewis did
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:54): Rhys is now at Qualcomm
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:54): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: ah. that's what I suspected, but their product page is broken, so I couldn't check
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:55): Rhys was a major force behind the Device Independence Activity stuff
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:55): Paul Duffin's latest email makes this perfectly clear
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:55): which eventually morphed into the Ubiquitous Web Applications work
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:56): and Opera Mini and WebKit ate their lunch
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:57): I'm trying to remember the name of that proposed vocab
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:59): DIAL
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:59): it was called
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:00): http://www.w3.org/TR/dial/
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:00): they are still working on that, it seems
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:00): "This document has been discontinued as part of the closure the Ubiquitous Web Applications Working Group."
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:01): I hadn't noticed the group had been closed. what happened?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:02): Opera Mini ;p
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:03): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: er, I guess I should know the answer to that question‚Ä¶ but to be honest, I don't
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:03): maybe no longer enough member interest
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:03): Rhy was for quite a long time the major force in sorta singlehandedly keeping some of that work going
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:04): architect of sorts
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:04): behind a lot of it
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:04): geolocation is in a different activity? whoa
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:04): and when Rhys moved on, not sure anybody else was prepared to step in and pick up the work
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:06): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: W3C activity classifications are somewhat artificial constructs that don't necessarily affect much
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:06): given that patent policy is all per-spec
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:06): or per-WG
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:06): yeah, could just move to a flat structure
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:07): yeah, there are a lot people who think that might work better
